directives.label: alg-euclidean-gas
directives.title: Euclidean Gas Update
directives.content:
Given a swarm state $\mathcal S_t=(w_1,\dots,w_N)$ with walkers $w_i=(x_i,v_i,s_i)$, the Euclidean Gas performs one update as follows:

1.  **Cemetery check.** If all walkers are dead (no alive indice...
directives.first_math:
\begin{aligned}
& \textbf{Input:} \mathcal S_t = \{(x_i^{(t)}, v_i^{(t)}, s_i^{(t)})\}_{i=1}^N\text{; and parameters } \alpha, \beta, \varepsilon_{\mathrm{std}}, \eta, \tau, p_{\max}, \varepsilon_{\mathrm{clone}}, \sigma_x, \alpha_{\text{restitution}}, \sigma_v, \\
& \qquad \sigma'_{\mathrm{patch}}, g_A, \mathbb C_i, Q_{\delta}, \Psi_{\mathrm{kin,BAOAB}}. \\
& \textbf{If } |\mathcal A_t| = 0: \textbf{ return } \delta_{\mathcal S_t} \quad \text{\# Cemetery absorption} \\
\\
& \underline{\text{Stage 2a: Raw vectors on alive set}} \\
& \dots \quad \text{\# Unchanged} \\
\\
& \underline{\text{Stage 2b: Patched standardisation}} \\
& \dots \quad \text{\# Unchanged} \\
\\
& \underline{\text{Stage 2c: Logistic rescale of components}} \\
& \dots \quad \text{\# Unchanged} \\
\\
& \underline{\text{Stage 2d: Assemble full vectors with floors}} \\
& \dots \quad \text{\# Unchanged} \\
\\
& \underline{\text{Stage 3: Cloning transition}} \\
& \dots \quad \text{\# Unchanged logic, produces } (x_i^{(t+\frac{1}{2})}, v_i^{(t+\frac{1}{2})}) \\
\\
& \underline{\text{Stage 4: Langevin perturbation and status refresh}} \\
& \mathcal S_{\mathrm{pert}} \sim \Psi_{\mathrm{kin,BAOAB}}(\{(x_i^{(t+\frac{1}{2})}, v_i^{(t+\frac{1}{2})})\}, \cdot) \quad \text{\# BAOAB Langevin step with velocity capping} \\
& \textbf{For each } i = 1..N: \\
& \quad (x_i^{(t+1)}, v_i^{(t+1)}) \leftarrow \text{draw from kinetic step output} \\
& \quad s_i^{(t+1)} \leftarrow \mathbf 1_{\mathcal X_{\mathrm{valid}}}(x_i^{(t+1)}) \\
& \textbf{Return } \mathcal S_{t+1}
\end{aligned}

directives.label: lem-squashing-properties-generic
directives.title: Properties of smooth radial squashing maps
directives.content:
For any constant $C>0$ define $\psi_C: \mathbb R^d\to B(0,C)$ by $\psi_C(z):=C\,z/(C+\|z\|)$. The map $\psi_C$ satisfies:

1. $\psi_C$ is $1$-Lipschitz on $\mathbb R^d$.
2. $\psi_C\in C^{\infty}(\math...

directives.title: Lipschitz continuity of the projection $\varphi$
directives.content:
For $(x,v),(x',v')\in\mathbb R^d\times\mathbb R^d$ the projection $\varphi(x,v)=(\psi_x(x),\psi_v(v))$ satisfies

directives.content:

directives.label: lem-euclidean-richness
directives.title: Environmental richness with a kinetic regularizer
directives.content:
The reward $R(x,v)=R_{\mathrm{pos}}(x)-\lambda_{\mathrm{vel}}\|v\|^2$ with $\lambda_{\mathrm{vel}}>0$ satisfies the Axiom of Environmental Richness ({prf:ref}`def-axiom-environmental-richness`).

directives.label: lem-euclidean-geometric-consistency
directives.title: Geometric consistency under the capped kinetic kernel

directives.label: lem-sasaki-single-walker-positional-error
directives.title: Single-walker positional error bound in the Sasaki metric
directives.content: Let $\mathcal S_1$ and $\mathcal S_2$ be two swarm states. For a given walker $i$ that is alive in swarm $\mathcal S_1$ ($s_{1,i}=1$), let $\mathbb C_i(\mathcal S_1)$ be its companion selection measur...
directives.first_math: \left| \mathbb{E}_{c \sim \mathbb{C}_i(\mathcal{S}_1)} \left[ d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\varphi(w_{1,i}), \varphi(w_{1,c})) \right] - \mathbb{E}_{c \sim \mathbb{C}_i(\mathcal{S}_1)} \left[ d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\varphi(w_{2,i}), \varphi(w_{2,c})) \right] \right| \le d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\varphi(w_{1,i}), \varphi(w_{2,i})) + \mathbb{E}_{c \sim \mathbb{C}_i(\mathcal{S}_1)} \left[ d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\varphi(w_{1,c}), \varphi(w_{2,c})) \right]

directives.label: lem-sasaki-single-walker-structural-error
directives.title: Single-walker structural error bound in the Sasaki metric
directives.content: Let $i\in\mathcal A_{\mathrm{stable}}$ and keep the second swarm’s capped positions fixed. Let the initial swarm have at least two alive walkers, $k_1=|\mathcal A(\mathcal S_1)| \ge 2$. The absolute e...
directives.first_math: \left| \mathbb{E}_{c \sim \mathbb{C}_i(\mathcal{S}_1)} \left[ d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\varphi(w_{2,i}), \varphi(w_{2,c})) \right] - \mathbb{E}_{c \sim \mathbb{C}_i(\mathcal{S}_2)} \left[ d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\varphi(w_{2,i}), \varphi(w_{2,c})) \right] \right| \le \frac{2 D_{\mathcal Y}}{k_1-1} \cdot n_c(\mathcal S_1, \mathcal S_2)

directives.title: Mean-square continuity of the distance measurement (Sasaki)
directives.content: Let $\mathbf d^{(r)}$ be the expected raw distance vectors of swarms $\mathcal S_r$. With $k_{\min}:=\max\{1,\min(k_1,k_2)\}$, $k_{\mathrm{stable}}:=|\mathcal A_{\mathrm{stable}}|$, and alive-differen...

directives.label: lem-sasaki-aggregator-value
directives.title: Value continuity of the empirical moments
directives.content: Fix a swarm $\mathcal S$ with alive index set $\mathcal A(\mathcal S)$ of size $k\ge 1$. Let $\mathbf v_1,\mathbf v_2\in\mathbb R^k$ be two scalar value vectors whose components satisfy $|v_{j,i}|\le ...
directives.first_math: |\mu(\mathcal S,\mathbf v_1)-\mu(\mathcal S,\mathbf v_2)|\le \frac{1}{\sqrt{k}}\,\|\mathbf v_1-\mathbf v_2\|_2,\qquad|m_2(\mathcal S,\mathbf v_1)-m_2(\mathcal S,\mathbf v_2)|\le \frac{2V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}}\,\|\mathbf v_1-\mathbf v_2\|_2.

directives.label: lem-sasaki-aggregator-structural
directives.title: Structural continuity of the empirical moments
directives.content: Let $\mathcal S_r=((x_{r,i},v_{r,i},s_{r,i}))_{i=1}^N$ with alive counts $k_r\ge 1$ and let $\mathbf v$ be a scalar vector on the union of alive indices satisfying $|v_i|\le V_{\max}$. Set $k_{\min}:=...
directives.first_math: |\mu(\mathcal S_1,\mathbf v)-\mu(\mathcal S_2,\mathbf v)|\le \frac{3V_{\max}}{k_{\min}}\,n_c,\qquad|m_2(\mathcal S_1,\mathbf v)-m_2(\mathcal S_2,\mathbf v)|\le \frac{3V_{\max}^2}{k_{\min}}\,n_c.

directives.label: thm-sasaki-standardization-composite-sq
directives.title: Composite Continuity of the Patched Standardization Operator (Sasaki)
directives.content: The N-dimensional standardization operator $z(\mathcal S)$, when applied to the reward vector, is continuous with respect to the dispersion metric. For any two swarms $\mathcal S_1, \mathcal S_2$ with...
directives.first_math: \|z(\mathcal S_1)-z(\mathcal S_2)\|_2^2 \le L_{z,L}^2(\mathcal S_1,\mathcal S_2) \cdot d_{\mathrm{Disp},\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\mathcal S_1, \mathcal S_2)^2 + L_{z,H}^2(\mathcal S_1,\mathcal S_2) \cdot d_{\mathrm{Disp},\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(\mathcal S_1, \mathcal S_2)^4
